paper_abstract: We consider summation of consecutive values (phi(v), phi(v + 1), ..., phi(w) of a meromorphic function phi(z), where v, w is an element of Z. We assume that phi(z) satisfies a linear difference equation L(y) = 0 with polynomial coefficients, and that a summing operator for L exists (such an operator can be found-if it exists-by the Accurate Summation algorithm, or, alternatively, by Gosper's algorithm when ordL = 1). The notion of bottom summation which covers the case where phi(z) has poles in Z is introduced.
